data: `minecraft:angry` defines the entity's 'angry' state using a timer.

data.Name: angry_sound
data.Description: The sound event to play when the mob is angry

data.Name: broadcast_anger
data.Description: If true, other entities of the same entity definition within the broadcastRange will also become angry

data.Name: broadcast_anger_on_attack
data.Description: If true, other entities of the same entity definition within the broadcastRange will also become angry whenever this mob attacks

data.Name: broadcast_anger_on_being_attacked
data.Description: If true, other entities of the same entity definition within the broadcastRange will also become angry whenever this mob is attacked

data.Name: [broadcast_filters](../FilterList.md)
data.Description: Conditions that make this entry in the list valid

data.Name: broadcast_range
data.Description: Distance in blocks within which other entities of the same entity definition will become angry

data.Name: broadcast_targets
data.Description: A list of entity families to broadcast anger to

data.Name: duration
data.Description: The amount of time in seconds that the entity will be angry

data.Name: duration_delta
data.Description: Variance in seconds added to the duration [-delta, delta]

data.Name: [filters](../FilterList.md)
data.Description: Filter out mob types that it should not attack while angry (other Piglins)

data.Name: sound_interval
data.Description: The range of time in seconds to randomly wait before playing the sound again
